intro: Strigosella grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered strigosella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is native to parts of North America, particularly the eastern United States. Strigosella grandiflora is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora in its natural habitat.
